Height was a constant, tireless hero of the Civil Rights Movement. This month, let‚Äôs take inspiration from her example. #BlackHistoryMonth

She said, "I believe we hold in our hands the power once again to shape not only our own but the nation's future‚Äîa future that is based on developing an agenda that radically challenges limitations in our economic development, educational achievement, and political empowerment.‚Äù

For her powerful accomplishments in the struggle for justice, Height received the Citizens Medal Award, the Congressional Gold Medal, and the President Medal of Freedom. https://www.womenshistory.org/education-resources/biographies/dorothy-height

As one of the ‚ÄúBig Six‚Äù civil rights organizers, she was a key player in the Civil Rights Movement. She was often ignored in the press due to her gender, but behind the scenes she led the way, advising activists and presidents like Eisenhower, and LBJ.

As an active member of @dstinc1913, she organized college students and served as the sorority‚Äôs 10th National President for nearly a decade. Shortly thereafter, she became President of the National Council of Negro Women, a position she would hold for 40 years.

She began to work with the National Council of Negro Women, which she would later lead. Its founder, Mary McLeod Bethune, told her, ‚ÄúThe freedom gates are half ajar. 'We must pry them fully open.‚Äù
She earned a degree as a social worker, and continued her activism. She worked with day laborers in New York, Black women who were picked up from street corners and exploited as domestic workers.

Her political activism roots back to her high school days, where she became vocal among anti-lynching campaigns. As the only Black participant in a national oratory competition, she earned first place and a college scholarship.

If Putin tries to change Europe's borders with tanks, we must and will impose a high price. If not, we can be relieved, but we should not then reward him for taking Ukraine hostage and then "releasing" it. Efforts to fight Russian energy blackmail and kleptocracy must continue.

He might also calculate that we'd then hold all threatened sanctions indefinitely in reserve -- that the Nordstream pipeline would definitely go forward, and the U.S. and UK would shy away from the crackdown on Russian dirty money many were proposing before the current crisis.

If he pulls back, he might enjoy claiming that the scare had never been about the invasion force he'd amassed; that it was just American "hysteria" all along, that we'd tried to bait him into a war he never intended to launch, and smartly avoided.

I think it may still be possible that Putin has a different plan. After all, he pays no price for bringing Europe to the brink of war. But he's already hurt Ukraine's economy, and made himself the center of attention as the world debates how to address his demands.

In the coming days, Putin may launch an utterly unprovoked and bloody invasion of Ukraine, motivated by his fear of democracy and desire to reconstitute the Soviet Union. If so, the United States and Europe must ensure that Russia is weakened by this aggression.
